docs.title: Scalable telomere-to-telomere assembly with hifiasm
docs.text: This session is part of Biodiversity Genomics Academy 2023

docs.title: Session Leader(s)
docs.text: Haoyu Cheng Research Fellow in Biomedical Informatics, Harvard Medical School

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
By the end of this session you will be able to:

  1. Run hifiasm by yourself
  2. Understand different types of assemblies
  3. Understand how to improve the assembly quality when the results are not ideal

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
1. Understanding the terms genome assembly, reads, contigs, genome graph
  2. Understanding of linux command line basics

Please make sure you MEET THE PREREQUISITES and READ THE DESCRIPTION above

You will get the most out of this session if you meet the prerequisites above.

Please also read the description carefully to see if this session is relevant to you.

If you don't meet the prerequisites or change your mind based on the description or are no longer available at the session time, please email tol-training at sanger.ac.uk to cancel your slot so that someone else on the waitlist might attend.
